description:
General principles of biology that have been established by studies of microbes, animals, and plants and the viruses of these organisms will be covered. Emphasis will be on the basic chemistry of life, cell biology, molecular biology, and genetics. The study of developmental pathways and evolutionary trends in life cycles will be explored using plants as model organisms. 

Biology Majors and Pre-Medical students should take either BIOL 101 or 121. BIOL 101 is the companion course to BIOL 102, may be taken before or after BIOL 102. 

Lab fee $150.
name: INTRO BIOLOGY A

values.comments:
Most students had high praise for Dr. Poethig, especially for his clear interest in his field, incorporation of different media into lectures, and good sense of humor. Lectures were kept interesting and made connections to information beyond what is in the textbook. However, a sizable number of reviewers felt the lectures became disjointed at times and weren’t applicable to the class, making it hard to know “what [students] need to know for the exam.”
*Note: Less than 25% of students submitted written evaluations for this class

While many students felt Professor Sherwood was a kind person, they also felt she could be more enthusiastic toward teaching. Reviewers also said she did not always seem to be confident in the material she was teaching and repeatedly had to correct mistakes she had made.
*Note: Less than 25% of students submitted written evaluations for this class
